topics.body:
what about that rap opera album where it tells the history of a guy who quit school and tried to make it in the rap game and by selling drugs on a gang, only to get betrayed by his friend and but on jail.

once he gets out of jail he confronts his old friend who has stolen his work, both enter a shoutout and his friend dies, the guy realises his life is now gone because he tried to take the easy way with drugs and gangs and kills himself, then its later revealed his friend didint die cause he had a bulletproof vest, then he steals the protagonists raps and instrumentals and claims it as his own.

te story ends with the friend making it to mainstream.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54af71a96368720bd2b90400#post_54af71a96368720bd2b90400

When it comes to politics the whole scenario tends to become more greyer.

When it comes to that is usually a tactic, emphasis on usually, a lawmakers tend to go for those because it creates controversy and there's no such thing as bad publicity if you know how to exploit it (Which in these decade seems no one does), and putting themselves behind such a controversial topic makes people to talk about them and they get noticed by other groups, which in turn, gives them a window of opportunity to get into a new office.

Some are like that, others do it for what's convinient, others don't care, there's plenty of different cases, not just that.

"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54af72996368726e98f30000#post_54af72996368726e98f30000
SOunds like a Rock Opera plot.

Step 1: Show protagonist and their goals to do good or their dreams.

Step 2: They realize something is corrupt or have difficulty getting to their dream/goal but it looks like there might be hope.

Step 3: JK lol. Nope. They lose. Sucks to be you loser.


"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54af737f6368722d20840700#post_54af737f6368722d20840700
